cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn west-northwest toward the Yucatan Channel late Monday, then accelerate northward over the Gulf of Mexico and curve northeast across the southeastern United States toward the mid-Atlantic late in the 5-day period.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch for Pinar del Rio, western Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatan Peninsula, western Cuba, northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to Alabama/Florida Panhandle and interior Southeast U.S.
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: Not Available (Boston not listed in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible as remnant low passes inland to the west of Boston late Oct 30-31
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Massachusetts coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to heavy rain (1–3 in) possible late Oct 30-31
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and higher waves could affect vessel approaches to Boston Harbor late week
